availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles N. Buckman (Union County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Buckman. Father of A. Laura Buckman, William C. Buckman, and Benjamin W. Buckman. Married to Rose F. Buckman. Father of Martha E. Buckman, Matilda Buckman, Charles F. Buckman, and Ann E. Buckman. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 17.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 7.
Find A Grave, "Charles N. Buckman (December 16, 1812-September 20, 1868)," Memorial #7716103, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7716103 (accessed May 9, 2018).
